subject: Parenting
title: What Is Authoritative Parenting
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: What Is Authoritative Parenting.

hook.text: One parenting style outperforms all others in every study. It's not the strictest or the kindest.

buildup.text: Diana Baumrind identified parenting styles in the 1960s by studying families for years.

discovery.text: Authoritative parenting blends high warmth with firm expectations â€” love plus structure.

twist.text: It's often confused with authoritarian, but the difference is enormous.

climax.text: Authoritative parents explain rules instead of just enforcing them. Respect flows both ways.

punchline.text: Warm and firm wins every time.

quiz.question: Who identified the major parenting styles in the 1960s?
